alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 25 at 2:35PM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TUESDAY TO 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Castle Rock. * WHEN...From 2 AM Tuesday to 5 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Plan on sharply reduced visibility and difficult if not treacherous driving conditions. Road closures will be possible. The most severe conditions will be east of I-25.
info.instruction: If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet
